Soft links make it easy to have many versions of the Server installed side-by-side. Of course, you can only run one at a time.

# Shutdown MarkLogic
~/Library/StartupItems/MarkLogic/MarkLogic stop
mv ~/Library/MarkLogic ~/Library/MarkLogic_6.0-x
mv ~/Library/Application\ Support/MarkLogic/Data ~/Library/Application\ Support/MarkLogic/Data_6.0-x

# Install a 7.0 nightly. (Unfortunately there's no way to do this anymore from the commandline post-Mountain Lion <https://github.com/jmakeig/marklogic-bootstrapping/blob/master/side-by-side/ml-install.sh>. I'd be happy to be proven wrong, though.)

mv ~/Library/MarkLogic ~/Library/MarkLogic_7.0-y
mv ~/Library/Application\ Support/MarkLogic/Data ~/Library/Application\ Support/MarkLogic/Data_7.0-y

ln -s ~/Library/MarkLogic ~/Library/MarkLogic_7.0-y ~/Library/MarkLogic ~/Library/MarkLogic
ln -s ~/Library/Application\ Support/MarkLogic/Data ~/Library/Application\ Support/MarkLogic/Data_7.0-y ~/Library/Application\ Support/MarkLogic/Data ~/Library/Application\ Support/MarkLogic/Data

Or use my hand-dandy script <https://github.com/jmakeig/marklogic-bootstrapping/blob/master/side-by-side/ml.sh> to manage the soft links.
